questions.question: A car accelerates from rest at a rate of $2.5 \, \text{m/s}^2$ for $10 \, \text{s}$. What is its final velocity?
A baseball with a mass of $0.15 \, \text{kg}$ is thrown with a force of $12 \, \text{N}$. What is the acceleration of the baseball?
A box is pushed with a force of $200 \, \text{N}$ over a distance of $5 \, \text{m}$. How much work is done?

A hydraulic lift has an input piston with an area of $0.02 \, \text{m}^2$ and an output piston with an area of $0.8 \, \text{m}^2$. If a force of $50 \, \text{N}$ is applied to the input piston, what is the output force?
A $12 \, \text{V}$ battery is connected to a resistor. If the circuit has a current of $2000 \, \text{mA}$, what is the resistance of the resistor?
A $2 \, \text{kg}$ object is dropped from a height of $5 \, \text{m}$. What is its potential energy just before it is dropped? (Use $g = 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2$)
A pulley system lifts a $50 \, \text{kg}$ mass with an applied force of $100 \, \text{N}$. What is the mechanical advantage? (Use $g = 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2$)
An electric appliance uses $120 \, \text{V}$ and draws a current of $3000 \, \text{mA}$. What is its power consumption?
A person walks $50 \, \text{m}$ to the east, then $30 \, \text{m}$ to the north. What is the magnitude of their displacement?
A wheel has a radius of $0.5 \, \text{m}$ and is rotating at $2 \, \text{rad/s}$. What is the linear velocity of a point on its edge?
If $200 \, \text{J}$ of work is done on a machine and the output work is $150 \, \text{J}$, what is the efficiency of the machine?
A $5 \, \text{kg}$ object is moving at $10 \, \text{m/s}$. What is its kinetic energy?
A force of $5 \, \text{N}$ is applied to a piston with an area of $0.01 \, \text{m}^2$. What is the pressure exerted on the fluid?
A motor performs $600 \, \text{J}$ of work in $2 \, \text{s}$. What is the power of the motor?
What is the buoyant force on a $0.5 \, \text{m}^3$ block submerged in water? (The density of water is $1000 \, \text{kg/m}^3$ and $g = 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2$)
A $1.5 \, \text{V}$ cell supplies a current of $200 \, \text{mA}$ to a small bulb. What is the power consumed by the bulb?
How much time does it take a car to travel a distance of $150 \, \text{km}$ at an average speed of $75 \, \text{km/h}$?
A block of wood with a volume of $0.01 \, \text{m}^3$ has a mass of $5 \, \text{kg}$. What is its density?
A crane lifts a $1000 \, \text{kg}$ crate to a height of $5 \, \text{m}$. How much potential energy is gained by the crate? (Use $g = 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2$)
A resistor has a voltage of $10 \, \text{V}$ across it and a resistance of $5 \, \Omega$. What is the current flowing through it in milliamperes?
What is the total voltage of four $1.5 \, \text{V}$ batteries connected in series?
Four $1.5 \, \text{V}$ batteries are connected in series to a $12 \, \Omega$ resistor. What is the total current in milliamperes?
A circuit has a current of $500 \, \text{mA}$. What is this current in Amperes?
A device has a voltage of $6 \, \text{V}$ and draws a current of $1500 \, \text{mA}$. What is its power consumption in Watts?
What is the total voltage of two $1.5 \, \text{V}$ batteries connected in parallel?
